issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.description: This map can be accessed by multiple threads. We can either map it a {{ConcurrentHashMap}} or synchronize the calls to this class.
fields.summary: Static Map in IOContext is not thread safe

comments.body:
This patch also cleans up the class by making the members private and using accessors.

FYI [~xuefuz] - once committed to trunk I will merge again to spark to ensure we have the latest trunk starting next week.

{color:red}Overall{color}: -1 at least one tests failed

ATTACHMENT ID: 12689952 - PreCommit-HIVE-TRUNK-Build

[~brocknoland], the changes look fine, harmless at least, but do you have a repro case that demonstrates the problem? I think for MR/Tez, the JVM is single threaded (no tasks sharing the same JVM). We used to have the problem with Spark, but with the latest change, Spark is only using a thread local for the IOContext object. Therefore, synchronization on the Map object isn't an issue for Spark either.
I see. I will remove the synchronization and add some comment saying that spark is the only engine which is multi-threaded and thus it uses the threadlocal.
Sounds good to me. We might come back to the synchronization issue later, but for now, it seems okay.
Latest patch does the cleanup and adds comments about which engines use which data structures.
